title: Mysteries of a Barbershop
descriptions:
In this 1920s-style slapstick farce, a timid young man stumbles into a bustling city barbershop to prove himself worthy of a sweetheart’s affection. The shop, already a theater of chaos, is run by an overconfident barber whose “modern methods” are anything but. A parade of eccentric customers files in: a pompous general needing a trim, a poet craving inspiration, a society lady with a towering coiffure, and a mysterious stranger whose identity keeps shifting along with his mustache.

Each haircut becomes a calamity. Razors fly, lather piles into snowdrifts, and combs vanish into hair as the barber’s apprentice mistakes tonics for glue and perfumes for chloroform. A simple shave spirals into a duel; a hair-styling demonstration ends in a frothy explosion; and a misguided makeover transforms a dignified patron into an accidental avant-garde icon.

Meanwhile, a minor misunderstanding blossoms into a full-blown detective yarn: the mysterious stranger might be a jewel thief hiding in plain sight. Our hapless hero, swept along by coincidence and courage, improvises a daring pursuit through revolving chairs and collapsing partitions. In the end, the wrong people get shaved, the right people get kissed, and order—of a sort—is restored, as the barbershop resumes business with a fresh sign promising “Precision and Peace,” neither of which seems likely to last.
